thread.title: Nine burnt in Old Dhaka gas cylinder blast; fire at plastic warehouse reported
thread.title_full: Nine burnt in Old Dhaka gas cylinder blast; fire at plastic warehouse reported

title: Nine burnt in Old Dhaka gas cylinder blast; fire at plastic warehouse reported
text:
Nine burnt in Old Dhaka gas cylinder blast; fire at plastic warehouse reported Senior Correspondent, bdnews24.com Published: 2017-02-25 18:46:52.0 BdST Updated: 2017-02-25 19:43:20.0 BdST Nine people, including a woman, have been admitted to Dhaka Medical College Hospital with burn injuries sustained in a gas cylinder blast at an eatery in Old Dhaka. 
Five of them are in critical condition, doctors say. 
The incident occurred at food shop 'Mithai Swad' at Lalbagh intersection on Saturday afternoon, Dhaka Metropolitan Police Deputy Commissioner Md Ibrahim Khan said. 
The victims have been identified as employees of the shop Maruf Hossain, 20, and 'Sabuj', 20, passersby Sabbir, 22, Maqbul Hossain, 35, Farzana Panna, 28, Sonam Uddin, 50, and Hazrat Ali, 45, and rickshaw-puller 'Abdullah', 30. 
DMCH Burns Unit surgeon Partha Shankar Paul told bdnews24.com that five of them were in critical condition. 
DMP DC Ibrahim said the walls, doors, windows, and furniture of the shop were damaged in the blast. 
Police said a fire incident has also been reported from the same in Old Dhaka area. 
Fire Service Control Room office Mizanur Rahman said 12 units of fire crews doused the fire at a plastic warehouse in Islambagh's Chairmanghat area after efforts of one and a half hours in the afternoon. 
He could not say anything more about the reason behind the fire and the extent of the damage immediately.
